meanings.definition: Romeldales: a breed of sheep known for their dual-purpose wool and meat production.
meanings.sent1: The farmer raised a flock of romeldales on his farm.
meanings.sent2: The romeldales grazed peacefully in the pasture.
meanings.sent3: The romeldales decided to have a wool-shearing contest for fun.
meanings.sent4: The romeldales' wool was as soft as a cloud.
meanings.sent5: The romeldales' meat was so tender, it melted in your mouth.

meanings.definition: Romeldales: the plural form of romeldale, referring to multiple sheep of this breed.
meanings.sent1: The romeldales were herded into the pen for shearing.
meanings.sent2: The shepherd counted the romeldales to make sure none were missing.
meanings.sent3: The romeldales threw a party to celebrate their fluffy coats.
meanings.sent4: The romeldales stood together like a fluffy white cloud.
meanings.sent5: The romeldales' wool was so abundant, it seemed to shimmer in the sunlight.
